title: Why htmxr?
text: explaining htmxr , worth appreciating Shiny achieved. Shiny democratized web application development R users. handles browser--R communication invisibly, data scientists can focus entirely analysis rather web infrastructure. Shiny remarkably well: Reactive programming ‚Äî outputs update automatically inputs change, dependency graph Shiny manages R ‚ÜîÔ∏é UI integration ‚Äî widgets, interactive plots, tables ‚Äî everything lives R Rapid prototyping ‚Äî lines code give working app Ecosystem depth ‚Äî hundreds packages (shinydashboard, bslib, DT, plotly‚Ä¶) built specifically Shiny Shiny right tool rich analytical dashboards, scientific interfaces, internal data exploration tools.

title: Why htmxr?
text: Shiny htmxr built fundamentally different communication models: practical difference: Shiny, server reacts. htmxr, browser asks. Shiny maintains one R session per connected user. session holds reactive state ‚Äî inputs, outputs, intermediate computations ‚Äî Shiny decides re-evaluate outputs. model powerful ergonomic, means user consumes persistent R process. htmxr apps largely stateless. HTTP request independent. server computes something, returns HTML fragment, forgets. State lives database, URL, client ‚Äî long-lived R session.

title: Why htmxr?
text: Shiny reloads entire output blocks (uiOutput, renderUI) ‚Äî sometimes strictly necessary. htmx updates exactly targeted element, nothing . result smoother interfaces, less visual flicker, faster perceived experience. Try infinite scroll example see practice ‚Äî 53,940 diamonds loaded progressively, next batch cards appended DOM scroll event:
code: hx_run_example("infinity-scroll")

title: Why htmxr?
text: Shiny‚Äôs persistent session model means memory consumption scales linearly number connected users. pool shared plumber2 workers handles far concurrent users hardware. Deployment standard: nginx, Docker, VPS, cloud platform. Shiny Server license required.

title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: htmxr built around explicit constraints: Primitives, framework ‚Äî htmxr provides low-level building blocks. doesn‚Äôt impose page structure, routing convention, application model. compose app small, predictable pieces. HTML abstraction ‚Äî Every hx_* function produces standard HTML elements hx-* attributes. hidden layer, reactivity graph, virtual DOM. write R lands browser. CSS-agnostic ‚Äî htmxr doesn‚Äôt depend CSS framework. Use Bootstrap, Tailwind, plain CSS, nothing . R-centric ‚Äî logic lives R. htmx handles client-side interactions via HTML attributes ‚Äî JavaScript required application code. htmltools re-exported ‚Äî tags, div, p, etc. available directly htmxr, don‚Äôt need load htmltools separately.

title: Table with htmx-powered tbody ‚Äî hx_table
text: Builds complete <table> element <thead> <tbody>. htmx attributes applied <tbody>, making swap target. data NULL (default), <tbody> empty content loaded lazily via htmx (e.g. trigger = "load").

title: Table with htmx-powered tbody ‚Äî hx_table
code: hx_table(   columns,   data = NULL,   id = NULL,   col_labels = NULL,   col_classes = NULL,   class = NULL,   thead_class = NULL,   get = NULL,   post = NULL,   target = NULL,   swap = NULL,   trigger = NULL,   indicator = NULL,   swap_oob = NULL,   confirm = NULL,   ... )

title: Table with htmx-powered tbody ‚Äî hx_table
text: columns Character vector column names display. Defines <thead> structure (required). data Optional data frame. provided, rows rendered <tbody> via hx_table_rows(). NULL, <tbody> empty. id id attribute applied <tbody>. col_labels Labels <thead>. NULL, column names used -. Can named vector (c(price = "Price ($)")) override specific columns, unnamed positional vector replace labels. col_classes Named list CSS classes <td> cells, passed hx_table_rows() data provided. class CSS class(es) <table> element. thead_class CSS class(es) <thead> element. get URL hx-get (applied <tbody>). post URL hx-post (applied <tbody>). target CSS selector hx-target (applied <tbody>). swap Swap strategy hx-swap (applied <tbody>). trigger Trigger specification hx-trigger (applied <tbody>). indicator CSS selector hx-indicator (applied <tbody>). swap_oob --band swap targets hx-swap-oob (applied <tbody>). confirm Confirmation message hx-confirm (applied <tbody>). ... Additional HTML attributes passed <table> element.

title: Table with htmx-powered tbody ‚Äî hx_table

title: Table rows fragment ‚Äî hx_table_rows

title: Table rows fragment ‚Äî hx_table_rows
text: data data frame. columns Character vector column names include (order). NULL, columns used. col_classes Named list CSS classes add <td> elements, keyed column name. Example: list(price = "text-end fw-bold").

title: Table rows fragment ‚Äî hx_table_rows
